lines.content: Duke is a Command-Line Interface (CLI) application for task tracking. If you are a fast typist, Duke can get your task tracking done faster than most GUI apps.
1. Make sure you have Java version 11 installed on your computer.
2. Download 'Duke.jar' from latest github release by clicking [here](https://github.com/kewenlok/ip/releases).
3. Copy the file to the folder you want to use as the home folder for your Duke program.
4. Run the program in command prompt using `java -jar Duke.jar` command.
5. Type your command in the command prompt to interact with Duke.
Adds a new todo task to task list.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 1 tasks in the list.
Adds a new event task with date/time to task list.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 2 tasks in the list.
Adds a new deadline task with deadline to task list.
**Note**: The format of deadline should be `YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM`.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 3 tasks in the list.
List all the tasks in the task list.
Here are the tasks in your list:
Mark the specified task as done.
Nice! I've marked this task as done:
Now you have 5 tasks in the list.
Find tasks that contains a specified keyword.
Here are the matching tasks in your list:
Saves data and exits the Duke program.
Bye. Hope to see you again soon!
All data are stored automatically by Duke everytime a change is being made and when exiting the program. The data will be loaded in the next time of usage.

deadline|`deadline /by `
The format of deadline should be `YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM`.

* Splits parameter based on the delimiter specified by command type.
* If the parameter is less than number of required parameters, throws DukeException.
* @param parameter String parameter that needs to be split into multiple parts.
* @param delimiter Token that is used as keyword for splitting the parameter.
* @param numberOfParameters The number of parameters required for command to work.
* @return A string array consisting of all successful split parameters.
* @throws DukeException If the number of parameters is < the number of required parameters.
private static String[] splitParameter(String parameter, String delimiter, int numberOfParameters)
throw new DukeException("The parameter format for this command is incorrect!");

* @param numberOfParameters The number of parameters required for command to work.
* @return A boolean value indicating whether the number of parameters meet minimum amount.
private static boolean validateNumberOfInputParameters(String[] parameters, int numberOfParameters) {
